parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I take up, (b) I welcome, entertain, (c) I answer, (d) I suppose, imagine.

parse: Conjunction
str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.

parse: Preposition
str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Noun - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Preposition
str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Noun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Jericho, a city a little north of the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Jericho, a place in Palestine.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pipto; to fall into something that is all around, i.e. Light among or upon, be surrounded with.

parse: Noun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: A robber, brigand, bandit. From leizomai; a brigand.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and the base of duno; to cause to sink out of, i.e. to divest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Half-dead. From a presumed compound of the base of hemisu and thnesko; half dead, i.e. Entirely exhausted.
